definitionsBitsOff.definition: (BIT_initialized) Initialization in progress, reported analog values may be inaccurate.
(BIT_motornotready) A motor sense cable is detected and the motor settings have been read.
(BIT_enabled) The phase current outputs are disabled.
(BIT_active) The phase outputs are zero or disabled.
(BIT_spdctrl) The controller is operating in torque control.
(BIT_reverse) The controller is operating in forward.

definitionsBitsOn.definition: (BIT_motornotready) The motor settings have not been read.
(BIT_interlock) Interlock state. All faults must be cleared and the controller must be disabled to leave this state.
(BIT_enabled) The phase current outputs are enabled.
(BIT_standby) The ignition input is off. The controller is in a power saving mode with many internal circuits powered down.
(BIT_INdisable) At least one disable input is asserted.
(BIT_limiting) The output phase current is being limited by the phase-current limiting module.
(BIT_spdctrl) The controller is operating in speed control.
(BIT_reverse) The controller is operating in reverse.
(FA1_stuckthr) The throttle input was non-zero when the controller was first enabled.
(FA1_PDPINT) An internal over-voltage or over-current fault has occurred.
(FA1_lostcomm) Too much time has elapsed since the last message was received from the serial port, and the serial timeout function is enabled.
(FA1_SCItimeoutzero) The discrete throttle input is disabled and the serial timeout duration is zero.
(FA1_stuckthr) The throttle input was non-zero when the controller was first enabled.
(FA1_PDPINT) An internal over-voltage or over-current fault has occurred.
(FA1_lostcomm) Too much time has elapsed since the last message was received from the serial port, and the serial timeout function is enabled.
(FA1_SCItimeoutzero) The discrete throttle input is disabled and the serial timeout duration is zero.
(FA2_rgnexcite) The rgn+ signal is less than 3.9V, greater than 4.7V, or less than rgn.
(FA2_threxcite) The thr+ signal is less than 3.9V, greater than 4.7V, or less than thr.
(FA2_SOClost) The state-of-charge was lost due to corruption of the nonvolatile memory.
(FA2_SCInoise) Parity or framing error in serial communication.
(FA2_supplyI) The voltage on current sense signal shunt+ is greater than 120mV. This is most likely due to an open-circuit on shunt+ or shunt-.
(FA3_limphome) The controller is in limp-home mode, and the limp-home mode phase and battery discharge currents are being applied.
(FA3_dirlatcherror) The input direction has been changed while the vehicle speed is greater than VC_spdthreshold. Accelerating torque is disabled.
(FA3_softstart) The controller is soft-starting after being enabled with a non-zero input torque.
